summary:
I love Arya Stark but the only problem I have with the show version of her is that we don’t see any actual progress.
We don’t...
body:
I love Arya Stark but the only problem I have with the show version of her is that we don’t see any actual progress.

We don’t see Arya training, studying, or practicing anything in the show. Most of the situations she finds herself in, she’s backed into a corner and wins as the underdog by sheer will and determination. And when she finally safely meets someone who can teach and train her (Brianne), Arya is already her equal, if not better. That’s fine but I wish there was some actual training. I wish we had seen her doing some exercises, watching the faceless man, or even some doing push-ups. I just think that Arya the badass would have been so much better if we had seen the more suddle parts of her growth instead of the climactic to the death battles

summary: Y’all ever sit and think about how much you love both stark sisters and how much they love eachother? And how Arya would...
body:
Y’all ever sit and think about how much you love both stark sisters and how much they love eachother? And how Arya would canonically stab anyone talking shit about her sister? Or how sansa would slap anyone who talked shit about arya? And how they are two sides of the same coin? The sun and the mood? And need eachother to thrive?

God I just love Sansa and Arya so much

blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

summary: As an arya fan who doesn't like dany and who doesn't ship jonsa but likes Jon and sansa as siblings, I really don't want arya...
question: As an arya fan who doesn't like dany and who doesn't ship jonsa but likes Jon and sansa as siblings, I really don't want arya and dany to be friends.  Its some weird jonerys logic because Jon and arya are close so of course she will like their ship and be the best if friends even though dany won't think twice about smallfolk suffering in her pursuit if power like with that lhazareen village and arya respects small folk and knows they suffer the consequences of abuse of power.
answer: Arya will find Dany high strung and power hungry and also not think that she has the best interests of her brother, her family and the North at heart.

summary: Arya Stark ‘Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a snake. Calm as still water. Fear cuts...
caption:
Arya Stark

‘Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a snake. Calm as still water. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Strong as a bear. Fierce as a wolverine. Fear cuts deeper than swords. The man who fears losing has already lost. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Fear cuts deeper than swords.’
― George R.R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: From the books.  The only thing that scared her about today was Arya. Arya had a way of ruining everything. You never knew what...
body:
From the books.

The only thing that scared her about today was Arya. Arya had a way of ruining everything. You never knew what she would do. (Sansa, AGoT)

One day she came back grinning her horsey grin, her hair all tangled and her clothes covered in mud, clutching a raggedy bunch of purple and green flowers for Father. Sansa kept hoping he would tell Arya to behave herself and act like the highborn lady she was supposed to be, but he never did, he only hugged her and thanked her for the flowers. That just made her worse. (Sansa, AGoT)

She gave Lady a quick little hug. Lady licked her cheek. Sansa giggled. Arya heard and whirled around, glaring. “I don’t care what you say, I’m going out riding.” Her long horsey face got the stubborn look that meant she was going to do something willful. (Sansa, AGoT)

All she wanted was for things to be nice and pretty, the way they were in the songs. Why couldn’t Arya be sweet and delicate and kind, like Princess Myrcella? She would have liked a sister like that. Sansa could never understand how two sisters, born only two years apart, could be so different. It would have been easier if Arya had been a bastard, like their half brother Jon. She even looked like Jon, with the long face and brown hair of the Starks, and nothing of their lady mother in her face or her coloring. And Jon’s mother had been common, or so people whispered. Once, when she was littler, Sansa had even asked Mother if perhaps there hadn’t been some mistake. Perhaps the grumkins had stolen her real sister. But Mother had only laughed and said no, Arya was her daughter and Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. Sansa could not think why Mother would want to lie about it, so she supposed it had to be true.   (Sansa, AGoT)

At first she thought she hated him for what they’d done to Lady, but after Sansa had wept her eyes dry, she told herself that it had not been Joffrey’s doing, not truly. The queen had done it; she was the one to hate, her and Arya. Nothing bad would have happened except for Arya. (Sansa, A GoT)

“You have juice on your face, Your Grace,” Arya said.It was running down her nose and stinging her eyes. Sansa wiped it away with a napkin. When she saw what the fruit in her lap had done to her beautiful ivory silk dress, she shrieked again. “You’re horrible,” she screamed at her sister. “They should have killed you instead of Lady!” (Sansa, AGoT) -

“Arya started it,” Sansa said quickly, anxious to have the first word. “She called me a liar and threw an orange at me and spoiled my dress, the ivory silk, the one Queen Cersei gave me when I was betrothed to Prince Joffrey. She hates that I’m going to marry the prince. She tries to spoil everything, Father, she can’t stand for anything to be beautiful or nice or splendid.”

Finally she found her voice. “What about my dress?”   “Maybe … I could wash it,” Arya said doubtfully.“Washing won’t do any good,” Sansa said. “Not if you scrubbed all day and all night. The silk is ruined.”   “Then I’ll … make you a new one,” Arya said. Sansa threw back her head in disdain. “You? You couldn’t sew a dress fit to clean the pigsties.” (Sansa, AGoT) -

“Send Arya away, she started it, Father, I swear it. I’ll be good, you’ll see, just let me stay and I promise to be as fine and noble and courteous as the queen.” (Sansa, AGoT)

Arya was chewing at her lip in that disgusting way she had. (Sansa, AGoT)

“It won’t be so bad, Sansa,” Arya said. “We’re going to sail on a galley. It will be an adventure, and then we’ll be with Bran and Robb again, and Old Nan and Hodor and the rest.” She touched her on the arm.“Hodor!” Sansa yelled. “You ought to marry Hodor, you’re just like him, stupid and hairy and ugly!” (Sansa, AGoT)

“I’m not like Arya,” Sansa blurted. “She has the traitor’s blood, not me. I’m good, ask Septa Mordane, she’ll tell you, I only want to be Joffrey’s loyal and loving wife.” (Sansa, AGoT)

Sansa found herself thinking of Lady again. She could smell out falsehood, she could, but she was dead, Father had killed her, on account of Arya. (Sansa, ACoK)

Sansa had once dreamt of having a sister like Margaery; beautiful and gentle, with all the world’s graces at her command. Arya had been entirely unsatisfactory as sisters went. (Sansa, ACoK)

Talk like that will get you killed, or worse. That lesson he had learned as Reek. “You are the real Arya, my lady. Arya of House Stark, Lord Eddard’s daughter, heir to Winterfell.” Her name, she had to know her name. “Arya Underfoot. Your sister used to call you Arya Horseface.” “It was me made up that name. Her face was long and horsey. Mine isn’t. I was pretty.” (The Prince of Winterfell, ADwD)

Sansa kept hoping he would tell Arya to behave herself and act like the highborn lady she was supposed to be, but he never did, he only hugged her and thanked her for the flowers. That just made her worse. (Sansa, AGoT)

She gave Lady a quick little hug. Lady licked her cheek. Sansa giggled. Arya heard and whirled around, glaring. “I don’t care what you say, I’m going out riding.” Her long horsey face got the stubborn look that meant she was going to do something willful. (Sansa, AGoT)

All she wanted was for things to be nice and pretty, the way they were in the songs. Why couldn’t Arya be sweet and delicate and kind, like Princess Myrcella? She would have liked a sister like that. Sansa could never understand how two sisters, born only two years apart, could be so different. It would have been easier if Arya had been a bastard, like their half brother Jon. She even looked like Jon, with the long face and brown hair of the Starks, and nothing of their lady mother in her face or her coloring. And Jon’s mother had been common, or so people whispered. Once, when she was littler, Sansa had even asked Mother if perhaps there hadn’t been some mistake. Perhaps the grumkins had stolen her real sister. But Mother had only laughed and said no, Arya was her daughter and Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. Sansa could not think why Mother would want to lie about it, so she supposed it had to be true.   (Sansa, AGoT)

At first she thought she hated him for what they’d done to Lady, but after Sansa had wept her eyes dry, she told herself that it had not been Joffrey’s doing, not truly. The queen had done it; she was the one to hate, her and Arya. Nothing bad would have happened except for Arya. (Sansa, A GoT)

“You have juice on your face, Your Grace,” Arya said.It was running down her nose and stinging her eyes. Sansa wiped it away with a napkin. When she saw what the fruit in her lap had done to her beautiful ivory silk dress, she shrieked again. “You’re horrible,” she screamed at her sister. “They should have killed you instead of Lady!” (Sansa, AGoT) -

“Arya started it,” Sansa said quickly, anxious to have the first word. “She called me a liar and threw an orange at me and spoiled my dress, the ivory silk, the one Queen Cersei gave me when I was betrothed to Prince Joffrey. She hates that I’m going to marry the prince. She tries to spoil everything, Father, she can’t stand for anything to be beautiful or nice or splendid.”

Finally she found her voice. “What about my dress?”   “Maybe … I could wash it,” Arya said doubtfully.“Washing won’t do any good,” Sansa said. “Not if you scrubbed all day and all night. The silk is ruined.”   “Then I’ll … make you a new one,” Arya said. Sansa threw back her head in disdain. “You? You couldn’t sew a dress fit to clean the pigsties.” (Sansa, AGoT) -

“Send Arya away, she started it, Father, I swear it. I’ll be good, you’ll see, just let me stay and I promise to be as fine and noble and courteous as the queen.” (Sansa, AGoT)

Arya was chewing at her lip in that disgusting way she had. (Sansa, AGoT)

“It won’t be so bad, Sansa,” Arya said. “We’re going to sail on a galley. It will be an adventure, and then we’ll be with Bran and Robb again, and Old Nan and Hodor and the rest.” She touched her on the arm.“Hodor!” Sansa yelled. “You ought to marry Hodor, you’re just like him, stupid and hairy and ugly!” (Sansa, AGoT)

“I’m not like Arya,” Sansa blurted. “She has the traitor’s blood, not me. I’m good, ask Septa Mordane, she’ll tell you, I only want to be Joffrey’s loyal and loving wife.” (Sansa, AGoT)

Sansa found herself thinking of Lady again. She could smell out falsehood, she could, but she was dead, Father had killed her, on account of Arya. (Sansa, ACoK)

Sansa had once dreamt of having a sister like Margaery; beautiful and gentle, with all the world’s graces at her command. Arya had been entirely unsatisfactory as sisters went. (Sansa, ACoK)

Talk like that will get you killed, or worse. That lesson he had learned as Reek. “You are the real Arya, my lady. Arya of House Stark, Lord Eddard’s daughter, heir to Winterfell.” Her name, she had to know her name. “Arya Underfoot. Your sister used to call you Arya Horseface.” “It was me made up that name. Her face was long and horsey. Mine isn’t. I was pretty.” (The Prince of Winterfell, ADwD)

summary: All Rivers Lead to the Sea - Chapter 1 - Shewolf_of_highgarden - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our...
title: All Rivers Lead to the Sea - Chapter 1 - Shewolf_of_highgarden - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/?
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Major Character Death, Underage
Relationships: Arya Stark & Hoster Tully, Arya Stark & Brynden Tully, Arya Stark & Catelyn Tully Stark, Catelyn Stark/Ned Stark, Other Relationship Tags to Be Added
Characters: Arya Stark, Brynden Tully, Hoster Tully, Catelyn Tully Stark, Edmure Tully, Ned Stark, Robb Stark, Jon Snow, Sansa Stark, Bran Stark, Rickon Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Other Character Tags to Be Added
Additional Tags: Arya doesnt go to kings landing, Arya is still ends up in the Riverlands, It starts out happy, ish, Family Drama, Eventual Romance
Summary:

“No, Ned. Arya is not ready to be in King’s Landing.”
“It is time for Arya to learn of the Southern court. She will not be a child forever.”
“I agree, but King’s Landing is not the place for her.”
“Do you have an alternative in mind?”
“If you are so set on having her in the South, I will write my Father. Arya can assist Father in Riverrun, the responsibility will be good for her.”

or

Arya goes to Riverrun instead of Kings Landing and surprisingly little changes for everyone else

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: no sibling has ever disapproved of the lover of their favorite bro/sis!
summary: Re Arya & Dany: I believe the “logic” is Sansa is weak/useless/feminine etc+ Sansa & Arya didn’t get along as children+ Arya and...
question: Re Arya & Dany: I believe the “logic” is Sansa is weak/useless/feminine etc+ Sansa & Arya didn’t get along as children+ Arya and Jon were close+ Arya is strong/feminist/“true Stark” etc = She as the true Stark sister of Jon who will support him no matter what will welcome Dany/ kill anyone who whispers against Jon and his Queen Bonus if Sansa’s included in a the ones taught a sharp lesson
answer: LOL.  Yeah, they see things only through their whole I hate Sansa logic!!  Thus, Arya would obviously like Jon’s new weird, uptight, imperious girlfriend because she and Sansa were at odds as kids.  I mean it isn’t like a sibling has ever disapproved of their fav bro/sis’s lover!  That has never happened in the history of the world according to Jonerys!

reblog.comment: LOL.  Yeah, they see things only through their whole I hate Sansa logic!!  Thus, Arya would obviously like Jon’s new weird, uptight, imperious girlfriend because she and Sansa were at odds as kids.  I mean it isn’t like a sibling has ever disapproved of their fav bro/sis’s lover!  That has never happened in the history of the world according to Jonerys!

title: Arya and Dany
body: Can someone please explain to me why Jonerys types think that Arya and Daenerys will be BFFs?  I actually sense the exact opposite with those two.  I’d think that Sansa would be polite toward Dany but Arya would be outwardly hostile toward her.  Like she would roll her eyes when Missandei began reciting her titles and the like.

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

summary: The fact that people still keep on insisting that Sansa had never bullied Arya and it was all just fun and games, literally...
body: The fact that people still keep on insisting that Sansa had never bullied Arya and it was all just fun and games, literally baffles me. LIKE SHE LITERALLY WISHED FOR ARYA’S DEATH!!! I know that she was upset about Lady’s untimely demise at that time and that she didn’t know better but it still doesn’t change the fact that Sansa bullied Arya. It doesn’t take those experiences away from Arya nor does it take away the insecurities she developed bc of the bullying.

Your tumblr source for HBO's "Game of Thrones" fantasy drama tv series & "A Song of Ice and Fire" epic fantasy novel series by George R. R. Martin.
